channel.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
channel.description:
Well just like Ubuntu promised. Their new version of Ubuntu came out in June 1st, and have updated it since. They supposively secured several holes and exploits. Before your installating password was stored on your computer, and they fixed that too.
I just downloaded it but I had problems with X-Server. Ugghh... So I needed to download it on my other partition, then I have to wipe out the old partition with linux on it, and finally install the new version of Ubuntu Linux
(and I have finals :( )
~Ron

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

you can type sudo su if your a fan of su. and to change the su password, type sudo passwd

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

Lol, when I first started I didn't really understand that. But it's in place so that newbies don't type something stupid and get rid of all rights or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

sppt:

ron, why didn't you just type su and then password before doing anything?
since su will give you root rights in the terminal for the whole session

Because Ubuntu dosen't have a usable root account by default.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

frank_:

i refrained from installing linux since ubuntu 5.10, mainly due to hardware conflicts stopping X from starting.

but, recently i installed it anyway, booted without the splash, saw what caused the error and added it to the blacklist, now its all sexy

LIAR! Anyway, I'm on Ubuntu Dapper 6.06 and it's run fine. I just got 5 ubuntu cds in the mail today :).

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

What? lol, xserver is built into the Ubuntu Linux .iso/CD and it would be quite some work to use an alternative. Right?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @deadlycow21 deadlycow21
item.description:
@deadlycow21 wrote:

Ron:

Good luck. I had so many problems with the X-server. I worked on the damn thing for 6 hours typing in 100s of commands starting with "sudo apt-get" lol. Pain in the ass. I hope you don't have the same problems. Otherwise time to redownload and reinstall.

snaptic is a much better alternative, it tells you what other packages you need to install with each package to make it work.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I can use the terminal. I can only use the terminal. When I bring it up, it says, Error error error x server fucked up. Opening in terminal mode. Then all I have is the terminal and I don't know how to fix it through that. If you know the fix please post it.

I got the new install disk, but the agravation of wiping out the linux partition and reinstalling it, would be tiresome. :)[br][size=1]Posted at: June 17, 2006, 12:02:19 am[/size][hr]I just found out that the new install CD has a built in Live CD. That is so much better than last time when we had to download two different .iso files both very close to 700 MB. Ubuntu seems to get better and better. I hope they keep doing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

edit the boot options so that it doesnt have "quiet splash" in it, then find what it says is causing an error

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

What caused the error? I looked in so many places, I even tried reconfiguring the x server... still didn't work.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux 6.0.6
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i refrained from installing linux since ubuntu 5.10, mainly due to hardware conflicts stopping X from starting.

but, recently i installed it anyway, booted without the splash, saw what caused the error and added it to the blacklist, now its all sexy
